alert.note: Alert for Northern Erie; Southern Erie (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 24 at 9:55AM EST until December 25 at 4:00PM EST by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM EST SUNDAY... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON EST SUNDAY... ...WIND CHILL WARNING WILL EXPIRE AT 10 AM EST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow occurring. Additional snow accumulations up to an inch today. Additional snow accumulations of 3 to 5 inches may occur tonight into Sunday morning, especially near and north of I-86. Winds gusting as high as 50 mph causing blowing and drifting snow. For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 10 to 20 below zero. * WHERE...Northern Erie and Southern Erie counties. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 4 PM EST Sunday. For the Wind Chill Advisory, until noon EST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. The cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Additional light snow accumulations are possible through the remainder this morning and gusty winds will continue to cause blowing and drifting snow into this afternoon. Visibilities may occasionally drop to a half mile to a mile at times, impacting travel along I-90, I-86, and I-79. The highest wind gusts are expected near the lakeshore. Lake effect snow will sink southward toward the lakeshore of Erie County this evening into Sunday morning, which may result in accumulation on roadways and reduced visibilities.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1. The Pennsylvania Department of Transportation and Pennsylvania Turnpike Commission remind motorists to adjust speeds based on driving conditions as winter weather impacts Pennsylvania roadways. Visit www.511pa.com for the latest travel, roadway, and traffic conditions.
